intro: Polygonum persicaria f. minus, commonly known as the dwarf knotweed, is a compact variant of the common knotweed. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, reddish-pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of around 15–30 cm, making it suitable for small garden spaces or container cultivation. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
